meanings.definition: To make a gesture with the hand, arm, or head to encourage someone to come nearer or follow.
meanings.sent1: She beckoned her friend to join her at the park.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse keeper beckoned the ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent3: The cat beckoned the curious dog to chase after a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The smell of freshly baked cookies beckoned the children from the playground.
meanings.sent5: The warm glow of the campfire beckoned us to gather around and share stories.

meanings.definition: To attract or summon someone or something with a gesture or signal.
meanings.sent1: The bright lights of the city beckoned travelers from afar.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of the delicious meal beckoned hungry customers into the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious sound in the forest beckoned the brave explorer to investigate.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of music beckoned memories of joyful celebrations.
meanings.sent5: The colorful display in the shop window beckoned shoppers to come inside and browse.
